newsitem.title: PERU: Peru, Germany sign 504 million mark debt accord.
newsitem.headline: Peru, Germany sign 504 million mark debt accord.

text.p: Peru signed Wednesday a 504 million mark bilateral debt refinancing accord with Germany as part of a series of agreements it is negotiating with 14 creditor nations of the Paris Club.
The accord was signed by Peru's Economy Minister Jorge Camet and the German Embassy's business attache Jurgen Steinkruger.
The debt will be repaid over 22 years with two interest rates -- 3.1 percent and 6.75 percent -- for the different portions, the Economy Ministry said in a statement.
The agreement will also allow Peru to swap up to 204 million marks of that debt for projects to fight poverty or protect the environment, the statement added.
